name: How can I help you today

remediations.Agnostic: What type of action you intend to do?

name: Private APIs
description:
Action Tips:
- Investigate into call graph for an API and explore its linked objects.
- Identify and tag the APIs to to facilitate data exchange between different internal systems.
- Right click on API node, under Graph Navigation > Get Start and End points connected to API.
- Right click on API node, under Graph Navigation > Get Call Hierarchy based on callers or callees
- Right click on API node, under Graph Navigation > Find Path connected to a target object.
- Save the view or export details for reference.

name: List of modules
description:
Action Tips:
- Drill down on nodes to access elements corresponding to the identified bug.
- Enable Insights from the right panel to identify impacted objects belonging to a module.
- Save the view with all objects belonging to a module.
- Annotate or Tag the objects of your interest.

name: All application APIs
description:
Action Tips:
- Fetch list of APIs based on access type (Get/Post/Put/Delete).
- Fetch list of APIs based on type such as (Public/Private).
- Investigate into call graph for an API based on its callees.
- Identify and tag the APIs to leverage existing functionalities and services.
- Save the view or export details for reference.

name: Open Source component
description:
Action Tips:
-Look at the adherence of your open source component with rest of the application 
-identify if CVEs exists and sort by criticality 
-identify the oldest components and prepare upgrade with test to done on application used by the open source component

name: Complete technology stack with frameworks
description:
Action Tips:
- Learn about all the technology object types used in your application.
- Learn about all the external frameworks used in your application.
- See the references that exists between them.
- Drill down on object types to see in details.
- Drill down on references to see in details.

name: Services architecture
description:
Action Tips:
- Learn about the services identified for your application. 
- Drill down on links to visualize the references between objects belonging to different services.
- Drill down on services to see all its associated objects.
- Save the view with all objects belonging to a service.
- Annotate or Tag the objects of your interest.

name: Dependencies with other applications
description:
Action Tips:
- Select a node and access properties in the right panel to obtain information about the application node.
- Drill down on application nodes to view objects belonging to an application.
- Drill down on the references to visualize the dependencies between application objects.
- Annotate, tag or insert text to collaborate on any dependencies.
- Save the view for reference.

name: Data Manipulation elements
description:
Action Tips:
- Learn about the data manipulation objects identified for your application. 
- Drill down on links to visualize the references between objects.
- Select an object to view its properties in the right panel, identify the transactions it is involved.
- Annotate or Tag the objects of your interest.

name: List of Service
description:
Action Tips:
- Drill down on nodes to access elements corresponding to the minor changes.
- Select the object intended to change and view the object properties in the right panel.
- Add linked objects to assess all the impacted dependencies.
- Highlight all the callers or callees for the object to focus on investigating dependencies. 
- You can also get detailed explanation to any object by enabling ChatGPT feature.
- Annotate or tag the objects to be tested for the impact of change.
- Save the view or export details for reference.

name: Public APIs
description:
Action Tips:
- Investigate into call graph for an API and explore its linked objects.
- Identify and tag the APIs to to facilitate data exchange between different internal systems.
- Right click on API node, under Graph Navigation > Get Start and End points connected to API.
- Right click on API node, under Graph Navigation > Get Call Hierarchy based on callers or callees
- Right click on API node, under Graph Navigation > Find Path connected to a target object.
- Save the view or export details for reference.

name: Component diagram
description:
Action Tips:
- Learn about the various architectural levels.
- Select a node and access properties in the right panel to obtain information about the objects corresponding to each layer node.
- Drill down on the view to learn more about the technologies and frameworks discovered.
- Enable insights to identify any flaws or blockers staring from the architectural level.
- Annotate, tag or insert text to collaborate on any architectural changes.

name: Class inheritance overview
description:
Action Tips:
- Learn about the inheritance relationships that exists for your application.
- Right click on a class node and highlight Callers to understand its relations.
- Drill down on classes to see all its associated objects.
- Annotate or Tag the objects of your interest and save the view.

name: Container diagram
description:
Action Tips:
- Learn about the various architectural levels.
- Select a node and access properties in the right panel to obtain information about the objects corresponding to each layer node.
- Drill down on the view to learn more about the technologies and frameworks discovered.
- Enable insights to identify any flaws or blockers staring from the architectural level.
- Annotate, tag or insert text to collaborate on any architectural changes.

name: Search for elements by name
description:
Action Tips:
- Select the element which contains a bug by name
- Use Filter by panel to help you identify your element
- Investigate in source code
- Add linked objects to assess all the impacted dependencies.
- Identify Web pages impacted or Tables impacted using the Get Start/End point feature

name: Application adherence to third party components
description:
Action Tips:
- Learn about the adherence of the application to external components.
- Drill down into references to know more about connected objects.
- Mark external dependencies for an upgrade by annotating them and save the view for reference.
- Get insights on open source safety and identify external components with CVEs.
- Export this information to share with your team members for planning upgrades.

name: Project structure
description:
Action Tips:
- Learn about the orchestration of projects that exists for your application.
- Drill down on projects to see all its associated objects.
- Drill down on links to visualize references between objects belonging to different projects.

name: Data storage elements
description:
Action Tips:
- Learn about the data storage objects identified for your application. 
- Drill down on links to visualize the references between the objects.
- Select an object to view its properties in the right panel, identify the transactions it is involved.
- Annotate or Tag the objects of your interest.

name: Database structure
description:
Action Tips:
- Hover on the references to identify foreign key references
- Drill down on object nodes to view column details, including primary ley details.
- Select an object to view its properties in the right panel, identify the transactions it is involved.
- Annotate or Tag the objects of your interest.
- Right click on a node and add linked objects to the view its linked objects on the application.

name: List of modules
description:
Action Tips:
- Drill down on nodes to access elements corresponding to the minor changes.
- Select the object intended to change and view the object properties in the right panel.
- Add linked objects to assess all the impacted dependencies.
- Highlight all the callers or callees for the object to focus on investigating dependencies. 
- You can also get detailed explanation to any object by enabling ChatGPT feature.
- Annotate or tag the objects to be tested for the impact of change.
- Save the view or export details for reference.

name: Third-Party components
description:
Action Tips:
- Identify all the third party components and their versions used in the application.
- Identify the outdated versions used based on gap and release date.
- Identify the safer and closest version to upgrade.
- See the application objects referencing to these third party components.
- Investigate into details of references to know more about connected objects and assess the impact of upgrade.
